description: Triangle T(n,k): write n in base 9, reverse order of digits.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..1000 of triangle, flattened
prog: (PARI) A031087(n, k=-1)=/*k<0&&error("Flattened sequence not yet implemented.")*/n\9^k%9 \\ Assuming that columns are numbered starting with k=0 as in A030308, A030567 and others. - M. F. Hasler, Jul 21 2013(Haskell)a031087 n k = a031087_row n !! (k-1)a031087_row n | n < 9     = [n]              | otherwise = m : a031087_row n' where (n',m) = divMod n 9a031087_tabf = map a031087_row [0..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 07 2015
author: _Clark Kimberling_
